main event: An unidentified object was observed at sea, appearing as a brilliant white circle with an estimated speed of 1500 mph, and an exhaust or tail. The sighting lasted 2-3 minutes, and the object disappeared by gradually fading, not by moving elsewhere.
interesting points: The object appeared to be flat and projected directly toward the witness, with a strong silver-colored light
The witness was able to time the observation and estimated the objectâ€™s position and angle above the surface of the water
A pink cloud was present closer to the vessel, and the object appeared beyond this cloud and seemed to move in relation to it
The U.S. Air Force sought additional details and the witness reported the sighting to the staff captain of the ship, requesting the position of the vessel at the time of the sighting
The witness, who was a credible source, wrote a detailed letter to the U.S. Air Force providing additional information about the sighting
sighted object: unidentified bright white circle with a strong silver-colored light
witnesses: Ex-RAF officer, his wife, and other ship passengers
